preface.title: About this Guide
preface.para: This chapter introduces the SMT installation process and the SMT Configuration Wizard. The &smtguide; (⪪) for &sle; 11 helps customers to manage their &sle; software updates while maintaining corporate firewall policy and regulatory compliance requirements. ⪪ is a package proxy system that is integrated with the NovellÂ® Customer Center and provides key &ncc; capabilities locally at the customer site. It provides a repository and registration target that is synchronized with the &ncc;, thus maintaining all the capabilities of the &ncc; while allowing a more secure centralized deployment.

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: This guide is divided into the following parts:

listitem.para: This chapter introduces the ⪪ installation process and the SMT Configuration Wizard. You can install the ⪪ add-on together with your base program during the installation process or on top of an already installed based system. The ⪪ Configuration Wizard guides you through the individual installation steps.

This chapter introduces the &yast; configuration module ⪪ Server. the &yast; graphical interface lets you activate and configure. You can set and configure mirroring credentials, ⪪ database passwords, and e-mail addresses to send ⪪ reports, or set the ⪪ job schedule, and activate or deactivate the ⪪ service.

varlistentry.term: Installation Mirror and Source Updates with &yast;.

listitem.para: This chapter introduces the option to mirror the installation and update sources with &yast;.

varlistentry.term: Management for Client Machines to use ⪪

listitem.para: This chapter introduces the option to register client machines on &ncc;. The Client machines must be configured to use ⪪.

This chapter introduces generated reports based on ⪪ and &ncc; data. Generated reports contain statistics of all registered machines and products used and of all active, expiring, or missing subscriptions.
This chapter introduces the most important scripts, configuration files and certificates shipped with ⪪.

This chapter introduces the option to configure any client machine to register against ⪪ and download software updates from there instead of communicating directly with the Novell Customer Center and the NU servers.
